title: Research Services Project Manager
content:
At Qualtrics, we create software the world’s best brands use to deliver exceptional frontline experiences, build high-performing teams, and design products people love. But we are more than a platform—we are the creators and stewards of the Experience Management category serving over 18K clients globally. Building a category takes grit, determination, and a disdain for convention—but most of all it requires close-knit, high-functioning teams with an unwavering dedication to serving our customers.
When you join one of our teams, you’ll be part of a nimble group that’s empowered to set aggressive goals and move fast to achieve them. Strategic risks are encouraged and complex problems are solved together, by passing the microphone and iterating until the best solution comes to light. You won’t have to look to find growth opportunities—ready or not, they’ll find you. From retail to government to healthcare, we’re on a mission to bring humanity, connection, and empathy back to business. Join over 6,000 people across the globe who think that’s work worth doing.
The Role: We are seeking a highly motivated individual for the position of Research Services Project Manager. As a member of our team, you will have the chance to develop and enhance your project management skills while working in a dynamic and innovative environment. This role offers endless growth potential and the opportunity to excel in your career within our research services department.
Why We have this Role: As a rapidly growing organization, we are continuously expanding our research services and need a dedicated project manager to oversee our ever-increasing workload. This role is vital to ensuring the smooth execution of research projects, delivering high-quality results to our clients, and driving the overall success of our research services team.
How You’ll Find Success: 

Effective project management and exceptional organizational skills
Strong commitment to customer satisfaction
Establishing and maintaining relationships with clients, track project progress, and ensure timely delivery of research reports
Expertise in managing research projects and meeting client expectations will be crucial to your success

How You’ll Grow: In this role, you will have the opportunity to expand your project management skills, gain in-depth knowledge of research methodologies, and enhance your leadership abilities. We encourage continuous learning and provide resources and training programs to support your professional development. You will have the chance to participate in industry conferences and leverage networking opportunities to further your career growth.
Things You’ll Do:

Efficiently manage multiple research projects, from inception to completion
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define project scope and objectives
Develop and maintain project schedules, budgets, and resource allocations
Oversee the execution and quality control of research studies
Ensure effective communication and coordination with clients and stakeholders
Proactively identify project risks, issues, and opportunities, and implement suitable mitigation strategies
Continuously monitor project performance and adjust plans as necessary
Provide regular updates and reports on project status to senior management

What We’re Looking for on Your Resume:

Proven experience in project management, preferably in the research services industry
Strong organizational and multitasking skills, with a keen attention to detail
Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills
Proficient in utilizing project management tools and software
Knowledge of research methodologies and data analysis techniques
A drive for continuous improvement and ability to adapt to changing priorities
Bachelor's degree (or international equivalent)
Proficiency in English (written & oral)
1 - 3 years of experience in the SaaS or Market Research industry is preferred

What You Should Know about this Team: 

Our research services team is a collaborative and supportive group of professionals dedicated to delivering high-quality results to our clients. 
We foster a culture of open communication, innovation, and knowledge sharing. 
You will have the opportunity to work closely with subject matter experts and contribute to groundbreaking research initiatives.

Our Team’s Favorite Perks and Benefits:

Work-life integration: frequent office events, team outings, and happy hours
Qualtrics Experience Bonus (+ 1,800 USD gross per calendar year) is a program designed to provide experiences to our employees they might not otherwise have.
Creative office design fostering innovation and collaboration
Up to the value of MXN 6,250 per quarter can be reimbursed for a variety of wellness activities via our dedicated platform, Forma.
Qualtrics pays 100% of the premiums for employees and their dependents. Medical and Vision plans are through MetLife, Dental plan is through Dentegra, and Minor Medical Insurance is through MediAccess.
15 days per year (2 additional days per year after the 10th year, up to 25 days)

demographic_questions.description:
DEI (Diversity, Equity and Inclusion) is a cornerstone of our company culture. With strong views on diversity and inclusion, immigration, wage equality, and the universality of human rights—without regard to race, color, creed, gender, or sexual orientation— we will not be quiet but will amplify these views on behalf of our employees and organization. 

With this in mind, we invite you to participate in the following set of voluntary demographic questions. The data collected will be used anonymously and in aggregate, so we can evaluate our processes to ensure we're providing equal opportunities to applicants from all backgrounds. Your responses, or your choice not to respond, will not be associated with your specific application and will not in any way be used for individual hiring or compensation decisions.

questions.label: How do you currently describe your gender identity?
Where have you seen Qualtrics prior to applying? Select all that apply.

values.label: I am a member of the Qualtrics Talent Community
I learned about Qualtrics from a current employee (social networking, referral, word of mouth)
I attended a networking event or career fair
I have seen Qualtrics on social media (LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram, TikTok, etc)
I found Qualtrics through a third-party career site (Indeed, Glassdoor, University website, niche networking site, etc)
I have read content created by Qualtrics
I have used the Qualtrics product suite
I googled jobs and a Qualtrics role was suggested
I am a current Qualtrics employee

questions.label: This role requires a minimum of Professional Working proficiency in Englsh. Do you meet this requirement?
What year did you graduate with you Bachelor's degree (or International equivalent)?
Are you of legal age to work in the country in which this position is based?
Are you legally authorized to work in the country in which this position is located?
Do you now or will you in the future require Qualtrics to sponsor your employment in the country in which this position is located?
Are you willing to undergo a background check as part of this hiring process?
Have you ever worked at Qualtrics in the following capacities? (check all that apply):

values.label: I have not worked for Qualtrics in the past

questions.label: Are you related to a current employee of Qualtrics? If yes, please specify name and relationship. A "relative" is defined as one of the following: spouse or significant other, parent/step parent, child/step child, grandparent, grandchild, brother, sister, uncle, aunt, nephew, niece, first cousin, in-laws (mother, father, sister, brother, daughter, son).
